Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial Evaluating Pleth Variability Index in Orthotopic Liver Transplantation

Trial_Design.evidence: This single-center study included 25 patients undergoing OLT at Inonu University, Turkey.

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria excluded patients with cardiac arrhythmias, low left ventricular function, renal dysfunction, valvular heart disease, pulmonary hypertension, or fulminant hepatic failure.

Intervention.evidence: Patients were monitored using the Masimo pulse oximeter and PiCCO 2 system.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the pleth variability index (PVI) as a predictor of fluid responsiveness in OLT compared to other hemodynamic indices measured by the PiCCO 2 system.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the predictive value of PVI, measured over two surgical phases.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This single-center study included 25 patients undergoing OLT at Inonu University, Turkey.

Number_Analysed.evidence: During the dissection and anhepatic phases, 14 (56%) and 18 (75%) patients were responders, respectively.

Result_Outcome.evidence: PVI showed no significant predictive value, with an area under the curve (AUC) of 0.56 and 0.55 for the dissection and anhepatic phases, respectively.

Harms.evidence: No adverse events related to the intervention were reported.
